references.paper_title: Dynamic multidrug therapies for hiv: Optimal and sti control approaches
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical background for optimal control approaches in the context of HIV treatment, which is relevant to the offline reinforcement learning problem tackled in this paper.

references.paper_title: An optimistic perspective on offline reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational work for offline RL by introducing an optimistic perspective, which is highly relevant to the challenges and methods discussed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Offline reinforcement learning via high-fidelity generative behavior modeling
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the offline RL problem with visual inputs, which is the central focus of this paper, making it highly relevant to the current work.

references.paper_title: Lapo: Latent-variable advantage-weighted policy optimization for offline reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper tackles the offline RL problem by introducing a latent-variable approach, which is closely related to the model-based approach employed in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Fast and accurate deep network learning by exponential linear units (elus)
references.reason: This paper introduces ELUs, which are employed as activation functions in the world models, a crucial component of the proposed CoWorld architecture.
